alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Leavenworth; Linn; Miami; Wyandotte (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Wyandotte, Miami, northeastern Linn, southeastern Leavenworth, Johnson, Cass, northwestern Bates and Jackson Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1144 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Overland Park to near Leawood to 7 miles southwest of Belton to near Cleveland to near Louisburg to near Paola to near Osawatomie. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Overland Park, Olathe, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Shawnee, Blue Springs, Lenexa, Leawood, Raytown, Grandview, Belton, Prairie Village, Raymore, Grain Valley, Merriam, Harrisonville, Mission, Pleasant Hill, Bonner Springs and Paola. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 3 and 21. Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 419 and 422. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 2. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 212 and 235. Interstate 635 between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 470 between mile markers 0 and 16. Interstate 435 between mile markers 0 and 12, and between mile markers 60 and 83. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 220 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas...and west central Missouri.
